Reviews.Title: “Very friendly helpful management”
Reviews.Author: Kengele
Reviews.Content: This is situated a few metres from the Piazza Campo de Fiori (daily market and evening restaurants with terraces). It is an excellent location for anyone intereseted in Ancient Rome or the Vatican, or who wants to be near lots of restaurants and activity. The hotel is a lovely old building, with a tiny lift and a lounge on the mezzanine floor. The rooms are practical, clean, and fairly spartan. We had two rooms with 3 large beds in each. The bathrooms were clean and simple. The hotel management was very professional, and very helpful. I think this hotel is well worth the cost, considering its central location, but don't expect a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the location!!”
Reviews.Author: 77OZZY
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to have 1 major plus and that is location. It is right next to the Campo de' Fiori which is a nice little market square with a number of bars and restaurants . Just around the corner is the Pantheon and walk a little further to most of the other Major sites. I was only on a 2 night stay with my Nephew and we had a 6 nations match (Italy v England) to fit in so we walked the sites in one morning in a circular route which captured Pantheon, 2 churches,Colosseum, The Roman Forum, Palazzo del Quirinale, Palatine, Circus Maximus, Trevi Fountain, Victor Emmanuel II Monument etc - all in one morning (we walked past the sites rather than hanging about taking a thousand photos like others seemed to be doing)!!. Couple of other plus points are the value for money and the helpfulness of the staff on the 24 hour reception. All spoke good English and when I left my phone in reception they saved it until I got back. Don’t get me wrong the place is no palace and the rooms are basic with no breakfast facilitys but they were clean and the bathroom was spacious (as big as the twin room). We were staying in February and it was snowing but the rooms were kept warm by the central heating system - if anything slightly to warm but since it was absolutely freezing out I didn’t mind that our room was the warmest place in Rome!! The only negative was the smell when entering the room - bad plumbing! This soon Dissipated as we let some fresh air in and ran the shower. Would recomend purely on location alone as in the day we were busy and at night the atmosphere was good in the square even though it was snowing and a lot quieter than normal (apparently). The Drunken Ship gets lively after 22:00 and was giving plenty of good drinks offers early on and I can’t remember later on so the offers must have lasted all night (unlike me). Another tip for 1st time travellers to Rome – There are thousands of traffic wardens with a booth on every street corner but they seem to be a bad investment as the roads are nuts and dont seem to have any laws. Red lights appear to mean the same as green and what you think looks like a 2 lane road can suddenly become a 6 lane free for all. If you have to get a taxi just get in and close your eyes until you are either asked to pay or you hear the sound of crunching metal.. seriously it’s crazy!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Martel_8
Reviews.Content: We love Italy as vacation county and travel at leat twice a year. When we go to Rome we always stay at Albergo del Sole. Not very luxerious but what a location and a secret, lovely terrace to sit in late summer nights. Just ask for terrace rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very good on price and position but .....”
Reviews.Author: peter_miles
Reviews.Content: Who could wish for more than 3 days in Rome, after far too many years, and only one day taken up with work? And to find a decent hotel within walking distance of nearly everywhere at a reasonable (compared with nearby) price? The room was far from enormous but it was clean and comfortable. On booking, some confusion was caused between booking direct (145 euros - with shower) or through internet (90 euros but possibly without shower). Better safe than sorry, so we booked direct - but it transpired that most bookings through internet do actually get a shower. That is the luck of the draw - we preferred not to take the chance. There is only a slot machine for coffee and cold drinks which we failed to operate properly or at all; but the numerous cafes etc next door and nearby made up for that. The roof terrace is indeed charming; the 2nd floor terrace (by the incomprehensible machines) likewise. The numerous groups of American students, German ramblers and French families with young children did tend to make a bit of noise (even after 11.00 pm, despite the notices requesting them not to do so) but you get what you pay for. Someone will doubtless be able to explain why the youth of America feels it necessary to shout down a telephone at 1.00 am as if trying to make themselves heard across the Atlantic. These are minor problems - together with the occasional false fire alarm - which do not detract from the sheer convenience of the place and the price. Nearby hotels (which I investigated) started at about 350 euros per night. Fine if you are on expenses, but we are not. I am returning next month, so despite the fact that it is not cheap, it is still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, allowing us to walk to many of the big sites like the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, and Trevi Fountain. The room was nice, with A/C, and the service was very friendly. A great place to stay to see the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms not so nice”
Reviews.Author: drew_sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to the very central location which we loved. Yes the rooms aren't the best and it's not exactly cheap but the location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: marybseattle
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel. Dingy.dirty.dark.terrible rooms! We did not stay...we left immediately after seeing conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful rooftop garden”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMusician
Reviews.Content: This was the third summer that I have stayed at the Albergo del Sole as a member of the Rome Music Festival. The location is tremendous! It is a two minute walk to Campo di Fiore (buy your breakfast at the open air market) and a 3 minute walk to Piazza Navona. There are two beautiful gardens, including a roof garden with an amazing view of Rome. The hotel manager and employees were always very friendly and helpful to our Music Festival members. There is a great restaurant located immediately to the right (as you you are leaving) of the Sole. Their eggplant, spinich crepes, and lasagna are always wonderful. The lasagna is only available at lunchtime on Sundays- so arrange your schedule according!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, wonderful roof garden”
Reviews.Author: thomastravels5
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at this hotel with our two children ages 19 and 21. The location was perfect, the roof deck was a great place to sit after a busy day and look out over the domes. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel does not live up to it”
Reviews.Author: bazzau
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. But there are several short comings. The front office service needs some adjustment, the room is very small, and the services are generaly non-existent. This is a room only hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and good hotel in the historical center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CFU_7
Reviews.Content: it is not a luxury hotel but is very good positioned less than 1 min walking to Campo dei Fiori. it is the oldest hotel in Rome it has it charm. rooms are alittle small but they are clean, from some rooms you have a nice view, i recomand this hotel to those who are going with friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly help!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMusician
Reviews.Content: This was the second summer that I have stayed at the Albergo del Sole as a member of the Rome Music Festival. The location is tremendous! It is a two minute walk to Campo di Fiore, a 3 minute walk to Piazza Navona, and a 10 second walk to the church that Tosca begins in. There are two beautiful gardens, including a roof garden with an amazing view of Rome. The hotel manager and employees were always very friendly and helpful to our Music Festival members. I look forward to returning this June!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it once was”
Reviews.Author: Eltel6
Reviews.Content: I love this place and I've been staying here for years and years... and I've never written a review partly because I was happy to keep a bit quiet about it. But I've been back for a visit after a four year gap and while not much has changed in terms of the rooms and way the place is run, the prices have skyrocketed by nearly 25% in that time, making what was once a great budget hotel into a marginal and overpriced dive. That's a harsh word to use, but they charged me 100 euros a night for a miniscule, monastic room with tired furniture and a seriously bad smell of drains. When it was 75 euros a night I was perfectly happy with the 1930s chairs, vintage bedspreads, and vending machines instead of breakfast. And it does have some incredible advantages: a gorgeous, meandering rooftop terrace full of flowers and trees and shaded corners where you can sit with a bottle of wine, and possibly THE best location of any single other hotel in Rome. But this time round the place was overrun with several school groups of homesick teenagers slumped over their laptops, Skype-ing their friends back home. (I wanted to ask, why bother traveling in the first place? but that's for the forum, not here...) And another group of students had taken over the beautiful terrace with rack after rack of clothes they'd hung out to dry. Somehow that glass of Chianti isn't quite so appealing when you're sitting next to some backpacker's underwear. It's truly a shame about this hotel -- it's always been a wonderful bolt-hole for lovers of Rome with little cash. More and more these days it has the air of a hostel -- except no hostel I know of charges 100 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms on the 5th Floor, Nos. 514 and 515 had gorgeous views."”
Reviews.Author: DLPAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Albergo del Sole for a week Aug. 8-14, 2009, and traveled with our 12 and 10 year old boys. We're veteran travelers and always opt for accomodations that are very nice with a terrific location. We don't require luxury but aesthetics are very important to us. If you are looking for a "service oriented" hotel and luxurious accomodations don't stay at the Albergo del Sole. You'll hate it. However, if you want charming then shell out the 160 euros per room and ask for the 5th floor rooms. We had rooms 514 and 515 which had great views of the domes of San Andrea del Valle and Il Gesu. Room 514 had three twin beds, shower stall, and bathroom, while room 515 had a queen size bed with a twin. Both rooms had armoires for storage. The floors are tile and the ceilings have exposed wooden beams that were lovely. The folks at the front desk had car service arranged to and from the airport and yes we had to pay in cash for our rooms but I don't see how that's a big deal. No one asked to keep our passports. The hotel has a small elevator which we used when taking our bags up to the rooms, which were arranged suite-like. There are absolutely fantastic restaurants in the Campo di Fiori area, including Al Bric and Ristorante de Pancrazia (which is over ruins of the Theater of Pompi) which we loved. Plus Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trastever (south of the Tiber) are only 10 to 15 min. walk. Not far from the Vatican or the Roman forum either. Cabs available at cab stands near San Andrea de Valle and relatively inexpensive (4-7 Euro dpending on where you're going). The hotel was clean and delightful our entire week and I would absolutely stay there again. Molto buono!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location. Depends on the traveler if you like it here...”
Reviews.Author: m0nkie
Reviews.Content: This is what it is...The location is awesome in my opinion and i have traveled enough to know good and bad locations...About this place: It is really central to it all...If you like quaint and central to the culture of Rome, this is it. If you want luxury and plan to sit in your room and watch TV and have a long bath, then stay away. I have stayed here twice. My wife and I sleep in the room, shower and leave. We come back to drop off stuff and change for dinner. THis place is next to one of the GREATEST restaurants that are not too well known and is a total Locals place, Monte Carlo. Only a few blocks by foot. It has one of the best pizza joints in the world across the street and it is next to a live and buzzing night time hangout for both youth and middle aged folk alike. Sit at Campo de Fiori and have some wine from one of the outdoor cafes or restaurants or get a bottle and open it and drink it from a glass in the squalre with the other hundreds of people enjoying the night...it is like a high school party all over again. Back to the room, the staff is a bit rough, you are correct there. not too helpful at times. They give you a map and can call a taxi for you, but the rest i do not even bother. I like to go to the top roof and hang for a bit and smoke a ciggy and have a glass of wine before going out. it has a view of the roof tops of rome that is different from all the magazines. Its a bit eclectic. The shower is hot and the bed is soft. Its an old place and it shows but it is definitely inhabitable and central. in the morning walk outside, cut a left and go 50 feet for some quick breakfast at the BAR. A fresh scone, blood orange juice and a cafe. Chill for a spell, and then hit the sights that are well within 5 minutes in any direction. take what you want from this review but it is what it is. it all depends on the type of traveler you are and what you expect out of a hotel. I stayed in Venice at a 4 star and paid $500 american a night. it was awesome. And yet i always come back to the albergo for the ambiance of the location. I like having a room on the street so that at night i can open the window and hear the party goers. I enjoy hearing the world from time to time and it is cool. if i do not want to, then i close the windows. you can barely hear the street when closed. When in Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: KBT-Ott
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beat for its location, and I found my stay quite comfortable, with no complaints whatsoever. I found the price reasonable for the location, and, in my opinion, it's a very acceptable pied-a-terre that allowed me to walk to just about anywhere...and I did. My room, number 401, had a double bed (comfortable), chair and wardrobe, a bathroom with shower (clean!) and windows looking out onto the inner courtyard, with the domes of two churches peaking over the eves. True, it isn't a 5- or 4-star hotel. It does not have a restaurant on the premises and the entrance to the hotel is slightly foreboding for those of us that aren’t used to old cities. There is also a flight of stairs that must be taken to reach the front desk and the elevator, which could be a draw-back for those with accessibility issues. However, for the tourist, staying within the walls of the hotel isn't the goal. When visiting, I love to walk around and get a feel for the area. The Albergo Del Sole Al Biscione is perfect for the walker as its steps away from the Campo di Fiori and, within a 2 kilometre radius (1.2 miles), you’ll be able to find St. Peter’s Square, Trevi Fountains, Piazza Novana, Piazza Venezia and the Coliseum. Bottom line: you truly can’t find a better place to stay location wise. And there are restaurants, cafés and bakeries a-plenty just around the corner, providing a great variety of foods to temp your palate. (A suggestion: go to Il Fornaio (?) on Via dei Baullari, not even 2 minutes away. It’s a great little walk-in bakery with carry-away lunch fare and lovely, lovely desserts!) Finally, I found the staff a pleasure to deal with, but then I usually have a smile on my face and a kind greeting. They were so very helpful in answering questions and providing suggestions. My one negative comment: They don't take debit or credit cards (gasp!). They did, however, gladly take my cash ;o) Last word: On the whole, this hotel gets two thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “good location, but expensive and very basic”
Reviews.Author: Schiachi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well located -- which is I think its only plus. Within walking distance of a lot of things you want to see. We -- two adults, two children -- stayed three nights in a family room (210 euro per night, no breakfast). We were in a room at the front on the top floor and the noise at night made sleep very difficult. For that reason alone I wouldn't stay there again. Campo Di Fiori is a very busy area and to add to it there is a nightclub close to the hotel. Room very basic though that's fairly standard in small European hotels but the price was steep for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: EmBoLo
Reviews.Content: Everytime I've to stay in Rome for work, I book a room in this dreamful hotel. The position is marvelous: in the center of Rome, just few steps from Campo de' Fiori or Navona square. It's hard to find another hotel with the same prices in this area. My preferred rooms are on the top floor where it is the most astonishing part of the hotel: the roof garden. The staff is polite, hotel clean, can you ask more from this little gem?

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghBob
Reviews.Content: Expensive, unfriendly and definitely not customer orientated. Up a flight of stairs, rooms small and noisy and the hotel only accepts cash (which considering the high charges is ironic). No restaurant, no iron - the staff just did not seem to care. Location good but that is the only good point. We have not stayed in a worse hotel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Two stars, no charm, but a good location”
Reviews.Author: Saralaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and enjoyed being close to Campo di Fiore and Piazza Navona. As other reviewers have noted, this is not a charming hotel. Our (expensive 175 Euro) room had one double and one cot for three people. The walls and ceiling were white. The floors were tile. A small TV was mounted high on the wall. We had to keep our luggage under the beds. The bathroom was small. The maids made our beds but never cleaned the bathroom. We used the bathroom down the hall to supplement our small space. We had to use the aircon at night because the street noise and early morning gulls woke us up when we tried sleeping with the windows open. We found the clerk congenial enough, though. There are plenty of places to find breakfast nearby since it is not part of the deal at the hotel. Would we stay here again? No. It is an unmemorable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “really dirty and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: ateraxis
Reviews.Content: this hotel is more like a hostel. It is very dirty, stinky, loud and unfriendly. the location is good but still doesn't justify the cost. WE moved to the Albergo Campo de Fiore. Much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ugogurl
Reviews.Content: Although the service was cold and unfriendly, the location of this hotel can’t be beat. It’s only a few steps from Campo de Fiori, a busy square in the historic center of Rome with a fruit, vegetable and flower market every morning. The central location allowed us to walk all over Rome without depending on public transportation. We stayed for a few days in one of the rooms overlooking the inside garden, which was pretty, and quiet. The room was simple and small, of average cleanliness, nothing special. It’s supposed to be the oldest hotel in Rome so I expected it to have some character, but it was pretty non-descript. It was nice to have air conditioning, though. I booked this hotel based on a review I read in the MTV Italy book (a really fun travel book to check out), and the location was superb, but don’t expect great service. And I agree with other reviewers: the “cash only” policy can be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: StephGob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 1/2 weeks out of an 8-week tour through Greece and Italy. This was one of the best places in Italy we stayed in, and being there during the middle of the World Cup was quite the experience! The market and Campo di Fiore were so close! Quite the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: jiggydance
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews we were slightly cautious about choosing this hotel, but also very relieved to get a room just 3 days before we arrived. It was easy to find. We were put in room 211 which was tiny, but clean, a notice on the door said it was a single room(it had a double bed) so we queried this at reception and as they were full couldn't do anything that night. The next day we were moved to an amazing room with a great view. We stayed 3 days in total, the hotel staff were friendly. The best thing though was the roof terrace where we sat in the late afternoon resting our weary feet reading the guide book. The location was PERFECT, having walked around all of Rome we would not choose any other spot. We just wanted a clean, safe crash pad and this hotel gave us so much more. definately recommend. (just ask not to have room 211)

Reviews.Title: “great view, great stay”
Reviews.Author: stoweb
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the hotel for four days in July. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. The Campo de Fiore is 100 meters from the front door of the hotel and there is an open-air market every morning. Several good bakeries and coffee bars are also on the square. We walked to all of the major sights and only used a cab to go to the Vatican and to the train station. The staff was very polite and spoke english when we needed. We stayed in rooms on the top floor (w/good A/C) where there is a beautiful roof garden with chairs and tables and fantastic view of the roofs and cupolas of the neighborhood. This is not the Ritz, but it is a very reasonable price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE- GOT CHEATED”
Reviews.Author: nikhil77
Reviews.Content: okay well my wife and i went to rome from july 26th for 4 nights, adn after reading the reviews on this glorified (horrified) hostel, i must say it was miserable staying there. the day we get there, i check in, and the guy says we have a single bed, then i told him we were confirmed for a double room with a/c adn bathroom for 100 euros a night, i have it in writing: FROM THE EMAIL: "july 26 to july 30 (check out), we booked for you 1 double room A*/C with toilet and shower at the daily discounted rate of 100,00 €uro per room." the guy then proceeds to tell me this is not possible and it should be 128 euro. i told him just to check me in and i would bring him the printout. we get to the room which is tiny first of all and the bathroom is so small that everytime i turned in the shower i would hit the wall. the door has a slight hole in it as if some one was tyring to break in so you could see inside when the lights were on. all this didn't bother us because we had a great ****LOCATION**** and a/c, we are not high maintenence. so i turned the a/c on and we were happy. we took a nap and i had the a/c on at 18 C, and the a/c came on and off 3 times (cold air wasn't even blowing) and on the 3rd time the malfunction lights came on and remained on, and the a/c went off, so i had to pull the plug out and reset it and start it over. we left to go roam the city, and i told the guy about the problem, and he said: "keep the temperature at 22 C adn it will not happen and it is also good for your health", thanks doc. so we left, enjoyed ourselves and came back around 1:00 am, and the a/c was malfunctioning, so i reset it and put it on 22 C adn went to bed, i woke up in the heat of the night and saw the malfunctioning lights on again...so i turned it do 23 C and went to bed, at 3 am i woke up again sweating and it was malfunctioning again...this tiem i was irrate, i put on my clothes adn went to the night clerk who was sitting in the tv room with cold a/c, and he has the cheek to tell me that sorry that's how it is and nothing he can do. he pointed to his a/c saying that it was doing the same thing the night before. the next morning i told the old man at teh front desk and he shrugged saying there's nothing he can do, immediately i looked at my hand book on rome and i went aroudn the corner on via de chiviari to hotel pompezi and for 80 euro a nite, a big room, with a nice bathroom, and cold cold a/c. after looking at the room i went downstairs and booked it (they took credit cards by the way, the hostel did not so you can't even dispute the charges). hotel pompezi is great adn i would recommend it to anyone. i was so excited to go to rome and stay at albergo, but after the first night if i had to continue to stay there my vacation woudl have been ruined. can't wait to go back to pompezi nik/rakhi narwani

Reviews.Title: “convenient to everything, loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: segrest01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were part of a pilgrimage group that stayed in Albergo Del Sole for 9 days in Nov. 2005. We were on the second floor overlooking the courtyard. We enjoyed being able to walk most anywhere. We were in the heart of the old city.. It was easy to get a cab when needed. The people running the hotel are friendly and really try to assist you finding your way around. We didn't go to Rome to see modern buildings, we wanted to see the old city. This place is great and there is something for everybody within a block in any direction. Bakery, bank, coffee shop, deli and a quaint resturant next door. We hope to return soon and plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...nothing else”
Reviews.Author: goingtoROMA
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location but otherwise it is a glorified youth hostel..which is fine, but not for the price. The walls were like paper. I could hear people going to the bathroom from my bed and doors slamming, etc. Street noise is much easier to deal with than toilets being flushed in the middle of the night. We had a private bath and the toilet seat had the last guests hair on it, so no real feeling of cleanliness either. I stayed at the Relais Banchi Vecchi which is by far better for less money and only 5 blocks away. Bigger tv, huge immaculate room, breakfast and bahroom with a great tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: psl300
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Albergo Sole, the first 3 nights of our trip in Italy. It is located in a great central location. We walked everywhere.....to the Colliseum, Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona and more! It's definitely a basic, no-frills hotel. But, we were only there to sleep and shower. It's not exactly budget-oriented, but with such a great location, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo del Sole on both ends of our trip for a total of 4 nights. The first stay we were in the front of the hotel right on the Campo di Fiori. There was so much life going on right outside, and we loved it, but if you don't like noise, reserve in one of the back rooms. Also, if you like air conditioning, book one of the rooms on the top floor. OUr second stay we were in a back room with no air conditioning during a heat wave, and that wasn't as pleasant. For an extra 40 Euros, it's worth the fifth floor room. The staff at the hotel are great, always there to book you a cab or recommend a restaurant or give you directions. Right across from the hotel is a 24 hour shop where you can get anything - wine, water, snacks, breakfast, coffee - anything! There are stairs leading up to reception, but then you can get on the elevator for the rest of the hotel. This is one of the oldest hotels in Rome, and it is quite and adventure to be in the presence of such history. The rooftop patio is a nice addition, although with the Campo so close, who is ever there long enough? I would definately reocmmend staying at the Albergo del Sole for your stay in room, but be aware that this is a no-frills hotel. Also, if you are coming or going to the airport, organize with the hotel to get the 47 Euro transfer. It is worth it financially, and is a lot easier than the airport train.

Reviews.Title: “great location/ roof garden”
Reviews.Author: MWG12
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Sole al Biscione. The Campo Dei Fiori area is a wonderful place to stay. A bohemian young area with a vigorous night life and good restaurants. The location is excellant - convenient to all renaissance and ancient roman sights and the Vatican. Relatively quiet and away from noisy thoroughfares. Our room was modest but clean and comfortable. The roof garden, for those staying here in warm weather (and it was warm enough for us in mid-November), is wonderful, overlooked by the dome of St. Andrea del Valle, with plenty of potted plants. I would definitly stay here again. I have heard interior courtyard rooms can get warm in the summer but this was no problem in November.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: reegieluigi
Reviews.Content: Albergo Sole was referred to us by a friend who grew up in Italy and knew that the hotel's location was one of the best in the city. While it is right in the center of a beautiful piazza, the hotel itself is very basic. The rooms are tiny, and look to have been last updated in the 1970s. Not that this is a bad thing--in Rome a clean, safe, relatively inexpensive hotel can be heard to come by. This hotel only takes cash, which became a big problem for us when the Rome bank's internet connections went down and we couldn't get cash out. The gentleman at the front desk of the Albergo helped us to find a solution and was very kind about the situation. Choose this hotel for the location and for a simple no-frills place to sleep. If you're looking for luxury, choose another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem. Great location (right off the campo di fiori) and the views are amazing. Ask to stay on the top floor (E140) where there are huge, flower filled balconies that look out over the domes of several nearby churches. The top floor rooms are air-conditioned with charming wood-beamed ceilings. But note that the smaller, lower floor rooms are not nearly as nice and are almost the same price (E110-125).

Reviews.Title: “Started good progressively got worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice enough and clean enough. TV and unexpected air conditioner - though it didn't work so well. Friends in another room did not have an air conditioner and room was VERY hot! The security was questionable, doors very thin with unsubstantial locks. Windows same and lined the patio, easy for anyone to enter. Worst part was at the end of our stay. We requested a wake-up call because we had an early train to catch. Well, they didn't call to wake us up and the owner happened to be there and was very rude when I brought it to his attention that they failed to wake us. He also charged us each an extra $20 then what originally was quoted - with no explaination. They accept cash only and when I requested a receipt he hummed and sang and ignored my request while progressively getting louder with his singing. I ended up leaving because the taxi was waiting and so was the train. I think this man is a scoundrel.
